results.firPara: Choose the correct group-stage fixture by naming the countries that the cities belong to. All cities chosen are ranked in the top 10 for population in that nation. Example Turin v Cork would be Italy v Republic of Ireland

results.webTitle: Euro 2016 geography quiz: guess the fixture from the cities

results.firPara: Todays fluff should have known better

results.webTitle: Football transfer rumours: Robert Lewandowski to Liverpool?

results.firPara: And so the USA move on to the semi-finals (even if Bedoya, Jones and Wood do not). Thanks as always for following along with us and be sure to check out Steve Brenners full match report from Seattles CenturyLink Field.
results.secPara: This is only the USAs fourth ever win in the knockout stage of a major tournament. The previous three the semi-final win over Spain in the 2009 Confederations Cup, the round of 16 triumph over Mexico at the 2002 World Cup and their victory on penalties over Mexico in the 1995 Copa América.
results.webTitle: USA 2-1 Ecuador: Copa América quarter-final – as it happened

results.firPara: Jürgen Klinsmann called for courage and his players gloriously delivered.
results.secPara: A stellar display from Clint Dempsey in his own Seattle backyard helped Klinsmann earn his first major tournament knock-out triumph the 2-1 victory over Ecuador on Thursday night sends the US to within one game of the Copa América Centenario final.
results.webTitle: USA beat Ecuador in battle of Seattle to reach Copa América semi-final

results.firPara: Germany passed and passed. And they passed some more. But there was the clear feeling that one of the Euro 2016 favourites were missing something. Joachim Löw watched his team struggle for penetration, with Mario Götze typifying the issue at the top of the formation, and these finals had their first scoreless draw.
results.secPara: Germany have punished Poland at previous tournaments, namely the 1974 and 2006 World Cups, together with Euro 2008, but not here. They might have dominated the ball but it was Poland who could rue the passing up of the biggest chances. Their nicely pitched counterattacking approach almost yielded reward but twice in the second half Arkadiusz Milik was badly off-target when well placed.
results.webTitle: Germany turn off the power against Poland to leave it tight in Group C

results.firPara: Heres David Hytners match report from the Stade de France
results.secPara: Lets not beat about the bush, that was a harrowing watch. The fact that neither side really needed to win exposed a flaw in the format but the most obvious flaws were in the world champions, who are quite toothless in attack. Poland should have been better but Milik goofed repeatedly in front of goal when presented with the best chances of the game. Northern Ireland can still top the group. Ukraine are out.
results.webTitle: Germany v Poland: Euro 2016 – as it happened

results.firPara: A second Northern Ireland supporter has died at the European Championship after a man suffered a heart attack during the teams 2-0 win over Ukraine in Lyon.
results.secPara: Robert Rainey, who was 64, collapsed at Stade de Lyon shortly after Gareth McAuley had given Michael ONeills team the lead. Medics treated the supporter in his seat, erecting screens around him, but were unable to resuscitate him.
results.webTitle: Northern Ireland fan dies of heart attack during Euro 2016 win over Ukraine

results.firPara: The veteran goalkeeper says he has the utmost respect for Zlatan Ibrahimovic but the manner of Italys exit from Euro 2004 has not been forgotten
results.secPara: The veteran goalkeeper says he has the utmost respect for Zlatan Ibrahimovic but the manner of Italys exit from Euro 2004 has not been forgotten
results.webTitle: Zlatan Ibrahimovic and Sweden hold painful memories for Gianluigi Buffon

results.firPara: Manager dropped Kyle Lafferty and made five changes in total which helped put them on the way to a possible last-16 meeting with France
results.secPara: All roads lead to Lyon for Northern Ireland. Michael ONeills squad set themselves up in Saint-Jean-dArdières, in Beaujolais, some 40 minutes drive to the north of the city. Many of the teams supporters have based themselves in town, using the same logic of this being the perfect midpoint between Nice, the venue of the opener with Poland, and Paris, where they face Germany on Tuesday.
results.webTitle: Michael O’Neill’s gambles pay off with Northern Ireland win against Ukraine

results.firPara: Atmosphere in fanzone for Euro 2016 clash was raucous, fairly drunken but mutually supportive
results.secPara: As Gareth Bales long-range free-kick hit the back of the net, the England fan dressed as a crusader slumped to the ground, his expression forlorn under the mock chainmail helmet. A Welsh fan in a full-length dragon outfit standing next to him offered a sympathetic shoulder rub.
results.webTitle: Celebration and consolation as England and Wales fans meet in Lille
